content.raw:
Jordan,

You should not try to include your video file \(the .mp4 file\) to the version control repository.  Instead, you create a fork and add a text file with the name “video\_link.txt” which includes a URL to your video.  Here is an example from team “bumblebee”:

[#!/osrf/vrx-events/src/default/2019/phase1\_hello\_world/bumblebee/video\_link.txt](#!/osrf/vrx-events/src/default/2019/phase1_hello_world/bumblebee/video_link.txt)

You will notice that they created[ this pull request](#!/osrf/vrx-events/pull-requests/4/2019-phase1-team_bumblebee/diff) to add the directory \(bumblebee\) with the text file.

The submission process does take some getting used to, but we hope that once you get it figured out for Phase 1 it will be simple for the rest of the phases.  Let us know if you have other issues.

‌
content.html:
Jordan,

You should not try to include your video file (the .mp4 file) to the version control repository. Instead, you create a fork and add a text file with the name “video_link.txt” which includes a URL to your video. Here is an example from team “bumblebee”:

#!/osrf/vrx-events/src/default/2019/phase1_hello_world/bumblebee/video_link.txt

You will notice that they created this pull request to add the directory (bumblebee) with the text file.

The submission process does take some getting used to, but we hope that once you get it figured out for Phase 1 it will be simple for the rest of the phases. Let us know if you have other issues.
